Package Controller

Class MainScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller.MainScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class MainScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    Controller for the MainScreenView.

    Displays all the records and reports for the customers and the appointments.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    David Vaca

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void addUpdateAppointment​(boolean update)
      Opens the addUpdateAppointment window, using the update value to determine which controller to use.
      private void addUpdateCustomer​(boolean update)
      Opens the addUpdateCustomer window, using the update value to determine which controller to use.
      private void appointmentComingSoon()
      Displays an Alert window only after login containing information about any appointment starting withing 15 minutes after the login.
      private java.time.LocalDate getFirstDayOfWeek​(java.time.LocalDate startDate)
      Determines what local day is the first day of the week in order to use it to produce WeekView objects.
      void initialize​(java.net.URL location, java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
      Only the appointmentsTab tables are populated to save time.
      private void listeners()
      Binds the update and delete Buttons from the customersTable and appointmentsTable with their respective selection.
      void onAddAppointmentButton()
      The addUpdateAppointment(boolean) method is called and the boolean value is set to false since no update to a record is performed.
      void onAddCustomerButton()
      The addUpdateCustomer(boolean) method is called and the boolean value is set to false since no update to a record is performed.
      void onAppointmentsRefreshButton()
      The populateAppointmentsTable() is called in order to update the information on the appointmentsTable
      void onContactNextButton()
      Populates the contactReportTable with the next week to the one being viewed.
      void onContactPreviousButton()
      Populates the contactReportTable with the previous week to the one being viewed.
      void onContactReportSelection​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Uses a selection from the "Contact Schedules" table to select an appointment from the appointmentsTable.
      void onContactsRefreshButton()
      The populateContactComboBox(), is called in order to update the information on the contactReportTable
      void onCustomersRefreshButton()
      The populateCustomersTable() is called in order to update the information on the customersTable
      void onDeleteAppointmentButton()
      An Alert window is shown asking for the user confirmation before deleting the appointment record.
      void onDeleteCustomerButton()
      An Alert window is shown asking for the user confirmation before deleting the customer record.
      void onLocationNextButton()
      Populates the locationReportTable with the next year to the one being viewed.
      void onLocationPreviousButton()
      Populates the locationReportTable with the previous year to the one being viewed.
      void onLocationReportSelection​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Uses a selection from the "Appointments by location" table to populate the monthViewTable with the date selected.
      void onMonthNextButton()
      Populates the monthViewTable with the next month to the one being viewed.
      void onMonthPreviousButton()
      Populates the monthViewTable with the previous month to the one being viewed.
      void onMonthSelection​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Uses a selection from the "appointments by month" view to populate the weekViewTable with the date selected.
      void onTypeNextButton()
      Populates the typeReportTable with the next year to the one being viewed.
      void onTypePreviousButton()
      Populates the typeReportTable with the previous year to the one being viewed.
      void onTypeReportSelection​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Uses a selection from the "Appointments by type" table to populate the monthViewTable with the date selected.
      void onUpdateAppointmentButton()
      The addUpdateAppointment(boolean) method is called and the boolean value is set to true since an update to a record is performed.
      void onUpdateCustomerButton()
      The addUpdateCustomer(boolean) method is called and the boolean value is set to true since an update to a record is performed.
      void onWeekNextButton()
      Populates the weekViewTable with the next week to the one being viewed.
      void onWeekPreviousButton()
      Populates the weekViewTable with the previous week to the one being viewed.
      void onWeekSelection​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Uses a selection from the "appointments by week" table to select an appointment from the appointmentsTable.
      private void populateAppointmentsTable()
      Queries the appointment information from the database and uses it to populate the appointmentsList and appointmentsTable by creating Appointment objects.
      private void populateContactComboBox()
      Populates the contactComboBox used on the reportsTab.
      private void populateContactReport​(java.time.LocalDate localDate)
      Populates the Contact Schedules table using the appointments queried at populateAppointmentsTable() and the selection of the contactComboBox.
      private void populateCustomersTable()
      Populates the customers table by sending a query to the database and creating Customer objects for every record found.
      private void populateLocationReport​(java.time.LocalDate localDate)
      Populates the appointments by location table using the appointments queried at populateAppointmentsTable().
      private void populateMonthView​(java.time.LocalDate localDate)
      Populates the appointments by month table using the appointments queried at populateAppointmentsTable().
      private void populateTypeReport​(java.time.LocalDate localDate)
      Populates the appointments by type table using the appointments queried at populateAppointmentsTable().
      private void populateWeekView​(java.time.LocalDate localDate)
      Populates the appointments by week table using the appointments queried at populateAppointmentsTable().
      private void searchAppointments()
      Adds a listener to the appointmentsSearchBar to filter the appointmentsTable for anything input on the search bar.
      private void searchCustomers()
      Adds a listener to the customersSearchBar to filter the customersTable for anything input on the search bar.
      private void setCellRestrictions()
      Adds restriction to the table in order to avoid the user from reordering the columns of the tables.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        Only the appointmentsTab tables are populated to save time.

        The ResourceBundle is assigned to the mainBundle parameter which is used to localized the errors displayed.

        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - Location of the root object.
        resources - ResourceBundle provided in the LoginController class, used for localization of the GUI interface.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        setCellRestrictions(), listeners(), populateAppointmentsTable()

      • appointmentComingSoon

        private void appointmentComingSoon()
        Displays an Alert window only after login containing information about any appointment starting withing 15 minutes after the login.
        Since:
        1.0

      • listeners

        private void listeners()
        Binds the update and delete Buttons from the customersTable and appointmentsTable with their respective selection.

        Listeners are added to the mainTabPane and the contactComboBox in order to populate their respective tables and members.
        A lambda expressions are used in the listeners so the values can be automatically updated.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        populateAppointmentsTable(), populateCustomersTable(), populateTypeReport(LocalDate), populateContactReport(LocalDate), populateLocationReport(LocalDate), populateContactComboBox()

      • populateAppointmentsTable

        private void populateAppointmentsTable()
        Queries the appointment information from the database and uses it to populate the appointmentsList and appointmentsTable by creating Appointment objects.

        A loading animation is shown to prevent the user from sending more queries.
        A Runnable method is used in order to prevent the Application thread from freezing due to the time it takes to retrieve the information from the database.
        The Platform.runLater() lets the app finish the runnable task and then calls an action to be perform on the javafx thread. Therefore preventing a exception for trying to call javafx methods in a different thread.
        A lambda expression is used to make easier use of the Runnable and the Platform.runLater.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        searchAppointments(), populateMonthView(LocalDate), populateWeekView(LocalDate), appointmentComingSoon()

      • populateMonthView

        private void populateMonthView​(java.time.LocalDate localDate)
        Populates the appointments by month table using the appointments queried at populateAppointmentsTable().

        The first day of the week getFirstDayOfWeek(LocalDate) is determine from the provided LocalDate.
        The firstDayOfMonth is assigned so it can be used on the the previous onMonthPreviousButton() and next onMonthNextButton() buttons methods.
        The month and year are set on the respective label.
        Between 4 and 6 MonthView objects are created depending on the numbers of week that there are on the month using the monthStartDate and adding a week every time.
        The objects are then added to the monthViewList and set on the the monthViewTable.

        Parameters:
        localDate - A LocalDate used to determine the first day of the month
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFirstDayOfWeek(LocalDate), onMonthPreviousButton(), onMonthNextButton()

      • populateWeekView

        private void populateWeekView​(java.time.LocalDate localDate)
        Populates the appointments by week table using the appointments queried at populateAppointmentsTable().

        The first day of the week getFirstDayOfWeek(LocalDate) is determine from the provided local date.
        The weekViewStartDate is assigned so it can be used on the the previous onWeekPreviousButton() and next onWeekNextButton() buttons methods.
        The month(s) and year are get and set to the respective label.
        Every column title is set depending on the day it represents.
        A WeekView object is created for every timeSlot in the timeSlot list.
        The objects are then added to the weekViewList and set on the the weekViewTable.

        Parameters:
        localDate - A LocalDate used to determine the first day of the week..
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFirstDayOfWeek(LocalDate), onWeekPreviousButton(), onWeekNextButton()

      • populateCustomersTable

        private void populateCustomersTable()
        Populates the customers table by sending a query to the database and creating Customer objects for every record found.

        A loading animation is shown to prevent the user from sending more queries.
        A Runnable method is used in order to prevent the Application thread from freezing due to the time it takes to retrieve the information from the database.
        The Platform.runLater() lets the app finish the runnable task and then calls an action to be perform on the javafx thread. Therefore preventing a exception for trying to call javafx methods in a different thread.
        A lambda expression is used to make easier use of the Runnable and the Platform.runLater.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        searchCustomers()

      • populateTypeReport

        private void populateTypeReport​(java.time.LocalDate localDate)
        Populates the appointments by type table using the appointments queried at populateAppointmentsTable().

        The first day of the week getFirstDayOfWeek(LocalDate) is determine from the provided local date.
        The typeReportStartDate is assigned so it can be used on the the previous onTypePreviousButton() and next onTypeNextButton() buttons methods.
        The year is get and set to the respective label.
        A list of different types is created from the appointmentsList.
        A YearView object is created for every type in the typeList list.
        The objects are then added to the typeReportList and set on the the typReportTable.

        Parameters:
        localDate - A LocalDate used to determine the first day of the year.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getFirstDayOfWeek(LocalDate), onTypeNextButton(), onTypePreviousButton()

      • populateContactReport

        private void populateContactReport​(java.time.LocalDate localDate)
        Populates the Contact Schedules table using the appointments queried at populateAppointmentsTable() and the selection of the contactComboBox.

        The first day of the week getFirstDayOfWeek(LocalDate) is determine from the provided local date.
        The contactReportStartDate is assigned so it can be used on the the previous onContactPreviousButton() and next onContactNextButton() buttons methods.
        The month(s) and year are get and set to the respective label.
        Every column title is set depending on the day it represents.
        A WeekView object is created for every timeSlot in the timeSlotList.
        The objects are then added to the contactReportList and set on the the contactReportTable.

        Parameters:
        localDate - A LocalDate used to determine the first day of the week.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        contactReportStartDate, getFirstDayOfWeek(LocalDate), onContactNextButton(), onContactPreviousButton()

      • populateContactComboBox

        private void populateContactComboBox()
        Populates the contactComboBox used on the reportsTab.

        After querying the information from the database the list of contacts is set to the contactComboBox.
        A loading animation is shown to prevent the user from sending more queries.
        A Runnable method is used in order to prevent the Application thread from freezing due to the time it takes to retrieve the information from the database.
        The Platform.runLater() lets the app finish the runnable task and then calls an action to be perform on the javafx thread. Therefore preventing a exception for trying to call javafx methods in a different thread.
        A lambda expression is used to make easier use of the Runnable and the Platform.runLater.

        Since:
        1.0

      • populateLocationReport

        private void populateLocationReport​(java.time.LocalDate localDate)
        Populates the appointments by location table using the appointments queried at populateAppointmentsTable().

        The first day of the week getFirstDayOfWeek(LocalDate) is determine from the provided local date.
        The typeReportStartDate is assigned so it can be used on the the previous onLocationPreviousButton() and next onLocationNextButton() buttons methods.
        The year is get and set to the respective label.
        A list of different locations is created from the appointmentsList.
        A YearView object is created for every location in the locationList list.
        The objects are then added to the typeReportList and set on the the typReportTable.

        Parameters:
        localDate - LocalDate used to determine the first day of the year.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        typeReportStartDate, getFirstDayOfWeek(LocalDate), onLocationNextButton(), onLocationPreviousButton()

      • onAddAppointmentButton

        public void onAddAppointmentButton()
        The addUpdateAppointment(boolean) method is called and the boolean value is set to false since no update to a record is performed.

        Called when the add button from the appointments table is pressed.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        addUpdateAppointment(boolean)

      • onUpdateAppointmentButton

        public void onUpdateAppointmentButton()
        The addUpdateAppointment(boolean) method is called and the boolean value is set to true since an update to a record is performed.

        Called when the update button from the appointments table is pressed.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        addUpdateAppointment(boolean)

      • addUpdateAppointment

        private void addUpdateAppointment​(boolean update)
        Opens the addUpdateAppointment window, using the update value to determine which controller to use.

        After the window is closed the populateAppointmentsTable() will be called to show the updated information from the database.

        Parameters:
        update - A boolean used to determine which controller and titles will be used.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        populateAppointmentsTable()

      • onDeleteAppointmentButton

        public void onDeleteAppointmentButton()
        An Alert window is shown asking for the user confirmation before deleting the appointment record. If the answer is OK, a query is send using a Runnable and Alert window is shown depending on the result of the query.

        This method is called when the delete button is pressed on the appointments table.
        The populateAppointmentsTable() is called in order to display all updates to the appointments records.
        A Runnable method is used in order to prevent the Application thread from freezing due to the time it takes to retrieve the information from the database.
        The Platform.runLater() lets the app finish the runnable task and then calls an action to be perform on the javafx thread. Therefore preventing a exception for trying to call javafx methods in a different thread.
        A lambda expression is used to make easier use of the Runnable and the Platform.runLater.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        populateAppointmentsTable()

      • onAddCustomerButton

        public void onAddCustomerButton()
        The addUpdateCustomer(boolean) method is called and the boolean value is set to false since no update to a record is performed.

        Called when the add button from the customer table is pressed.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        addUpdateCustomer(boolean)

      • onUpdateCustomerButton

        public void onUpdateCustomerButton()
        The addUpdateCustomer(boolean) method is called and the boolean value is set to true since an update to a record is performed.

        Called when the update button from the customer table is pressed.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        addUpdateCustomer(boolean)

      • onDeleteCustomerButton

        public void onDeleteCustomerButton()
        An Alert window is shown asking for the user confirmation before deleting the customer record. If the answer is OK, a query is send using a Runnable and Alert window is shown depending on the result of the query.

        This method is called when the delete button is pressed on the customer table.
        The populateCustomersTable() is called in order to display all updates to the appointments records.
        A Runnable method is used in order to prevent the Application thread from freezing due to the time it takes to retrieve the information from the database.
        The Platform.runLater() lets the app finish the runnable task and then calls an action to be perform on the javafx thread. Therefore preventing a exception for trying to call javafx methods in a different thread.
        A lambda expression is used to make easier use of the Runnable and the Platform.runLater.

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        populateCustomersTable()

      • onMonthSelection

        public void onMonthSelection​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
        Uses a selection from the "appointments by month" view to populate the weekViewTable with the date selected.

        Called every time a cell from the monthViewTable is double-clicked.

        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - Everytime any cell of the table is clicked.

        1.0

      • searchAppointments

        private void searchAppointments()
        Adds a listener to the appointmentsSearchBar to filter the appointmentsTable for anything input on the search bar.

        A lambda expression is use in order to automatically update the table depending on the new values.

        Since:
        1.0

      • searchCustomers

        private void searchCustomers()
        Adds a listener to the customersSearchBar to filter the customersTable for anything input on the search bar.

        A lambda expression is use in order to automatically update the table depending on the new values.

        Since:
        1.0

      • getFirstDayOfWeek

        private java.time.LocalDate getFirstDayOfWeek​(java.time.LocalDate startDate)
        Determines what local day is the first day of the week in order to use it to produce WeekView objects.
        Parameters:
        startDate - LocalDate used to determine what date is the first day of the week.
        Returns:
        the local date that is the first day fo the week.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setCellRestrictions

        private void setCellRestrictions()
        Adds restriction to the table in order to avoid the user from reordering the columns of the tables.

        All the table columns are set a value factory in order to display the information from their respective objects. The selection model is changed to allow the single cell selection for the tables that require it.

        Since:
        1.0
